Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Sketch Create a new sketch on the XY plane (face_1) of the coordinate system for part 1: * Loop 1: + Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.0311, 0.0] + Line 2: [0.0311, 0.0] to [0.0311, 0.0311] + Line 3: [0.0311, 0.0311] to [0.0, 0.0311] + Line 4: [0.0, 0.0311] to [0.0, 0.0] * Loop 2: + Line 1: [0.0019, 0.0019] to [0.0293, 0.0019] + Line 2: [0.0293, 0.0019] to [0.0293, 0.0293] + Line 3: [0.0293, 0.0293] to [0.0019, 0.0293] + Line 4: [0.0019, 0.0293] to [0.0019, 0.0019] Extrusion Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis using the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.75 * Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.0311 * Operation: Create a new solid body</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. Next, draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. * Face 1: + Loop 1: - Line 1: Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.5, 0.0] - Line 2: Draw a line from point [0.5, 0.0] to point [0.5, 0.5] - Line 3: Draw a line from point [0.5, 0.5] to point [0.0, 0.5] - Line 4: Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.5] to point [0.0, 0.0] The sketch for Face 1 is now complete. Close the sketch. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined by the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the positive Z-axis to a depth of 0.5 units using the extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal parameter. This part is complete. The final dimensions of this part are a length of 0.5 units, a width of 0.5 units, and a height of 0.5 units. Part 2: Construct a second three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. Next, draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. * Face 1: + Loop 1: - Line 1: Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.25, 0.0] - Line 2: Draw a line from point [0.25, 0.0] to point [0.25, 0.25] - Line 3: Draw a line from point [0.25, 0.25] to point [0.0, 0.25] - Line 4: Draw a line from point [0.0, 0.25] to point [0.0, 0.0] The sketch for Face 1 is now complete. Close the sketch. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.25 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined by the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the positive Z-axis to a depth of 0.25 units using the extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal parameter. This part is complete. The final dimensions of this part are a length of 0.25 units, a width of 0.25 units, and a height of 0.25 units. Combine Parts: Perform a JoinFeatureOperation between part\\_1 and part\\_2 to combine the two parts into a single solid body. The front face of part\\_2 will intersect with the rear face of part\\_1, resulting in a combined shape that is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face is angled at 45 degrees. The final shape dimensions are a length of 0.5 units, a width of 0.5 units, and a height of 0.75 units.</description>
